metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Qinghai Lake integrated observatory network obtained from an observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of the Alpine meadow and grassland ecosystem Superstation from September 3 in 2018 to December 31 in 2019. The site (98°35′41.62″E, 37°42′11.47″N) was located in the alpine meadow and alpine grassland ecosystem, near the SuGe Road in Tianjun County, Qinghai Province. The elevation is 3718m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP155; 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, and 40 m, towards north), wind speed and direction profile (windsonic; 3, 5, 10, 15, 20, 30, and 40 m, towards north), air pressure (PTB110; 3 m), rain gauge (TE525M; 10m of the platform in west by north of tower), four-component radiometer (CNR4; 6m, towards south), two infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 6 m, towards south, vertically downward), photosynthetically active radiation (PQS1; 6 m, towards south, each with one vertically downward and one vertically upward, soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates below the vegetation; -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (109; -0.05、-0.10、-0.20、-0.40、-0.80、-1.20、-2.00、-3.00 and -4.00m), soil moisture profile (CS616; -0.05、-0.10、-0.20、-0.40、-0.80、-1.20、-2.00、-3.00 and -4.00m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_3 m, Ta_5 m, Ta_10 m, Ta_15 m, Ta_20 m, Ta_30 m, and Ta_40 m; RH_3 m, RH_5 m, RH_10 m, RH_15 m, RH_20 m, RH_30 m, and RH_40 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_3 m, Ws_5 m, Ws_10 m, Ws_15 m, Ws_20 m, Ws_30 m, and Ws_40 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_3 m, WD_5 m, WD_10 m, WD_15 m, WD_20 m, WD_30m, and WD_40 m) (°), precipitation (rain) (mm), air pressure (press) (hpa), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_D_up and PAR_D_down) (μmol/ (s m-2)), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_5cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_200cm、Ts_300cm、Ts_400cm) (℃), soil moisture (Ms_5cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_200cm、Ms_300cm、Ms_400cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2018/8/31 10:30. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.

该数据集包含了2018年9月3日至2019年12月31日青海湖流域地表过程综合观测网高寒草甸草原混合超级站气象要素梯度观测系统数据。站点位于青海省天峻县苏里路旁侧，下垫面是高寒草甸和高寒草原的混合。观测点经纬度为：东经 98°35′41.62″E，北纬 37°42′11.47″N，海拔3718m。风速/风向、空气温度、相对湿度传感器分别架设在3m、5m、10m、15m、20m、30m、40m处，共7层，朝向正北；气压计安装在3m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在塔西偏北侧10m平台上；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤热流板（自校正式）（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，朝向正南距离塔体2m处；土壤温度探头埋设在地下5cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、200cm、300cm和400cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正东方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下5cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、200cm、300cm和400cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正东方；光合有效辐射仪安装在6m处，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个，朝向正南。
观测项目有：风速（WS_3m、WS_5m、WS_10m、WS_15m、WS_20m、WS_30m、WS_40m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_3m、WD_5m、WD_10m、WD_15m、WD_20m、WD_30m、WD_40m）(单位：度)、空气温湿度（Ta_3m、Ta_5m、Ta_10m、Ta_15m、Ta_20m、Ta_30m、Ta_40m和RH_3m、RH_5m、RH_10m、RH_15m、RH_20m、RH_30m、RH_40m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_U_up、PAR_U_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒) 、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_5cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_200cm、Ms_300cm、Ms_400cm）(单位：百分比)、土壤温度（Ts_5cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_200cm、Ts_300cm、Ts_400cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2018/8/31 10:30。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，其中假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文指出，与观察到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验（Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces）中的蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）的比率，这项实验是黑河水联合遥测实验研究（Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research，HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is a two-source energy balance (TSEB) model in the context of evapotranspiration estimation?

Definition.AnswerEn: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model is a method to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation. It accounts for both 'above canopy' and 'under soil' cases in energy partition, addressing the heterogeneous nature of mixed soil and vegetation surfaces, and improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation and temperatures.

These measures ensure that the data accurately represent environmental conditions, which is essential for high-altitude stations where conditions can be extreme and variable.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制措施，如确保数据记录完整、去除重复或物理上不合理的数据点，以及标记可疑数据，有助于提高数据集的可靠性。这些措施确保数据准确反映环境条件，这对于高海拔站点尤为重要，因为这些地方的条件可能极端且变化多端。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes using data collection methods?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，准确估计蒸散发面临的挑战因素包括数据收集方法的多样性。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in heterogeneous landscapes is challenging due to the complexity of energy exchange between soil and vegetation, variations in surface temperatures, and resistance to energy exchange. Errors in determining component temperatures from radiometric measurements can affect model performance, particularly in advective environments.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中准确估计表面通量是一个挑战，因为土壤和植被之间的能量交换复杂，表面温度变化以及能量交换的阻力。通过辐射测量确定组分温度的误差可能会影响模型性能，特别是在有平流环境的情况下。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the limitation in applying existing evapotranspiration models to operational satellite and ground-based data?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致现有蒸散发模型在应用于卫星和地面数据时的限制的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Existing evapotranspiration models are limited in their application to operational satellite and ground-based data due to the complexity of the models, which require parameters and observations that are not readily available. The models also tend to have multiple resistances and complex energy partition assumptions that are difficult to calculate accurately.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 现有的蒸散发模型在应用于操作卫星和地面数据时受到限制，因为这些模型复杂，要求的参数和观测数据并不容易获得。这些模型通常具有多个阻力和复杂的能量分配假设，难以准确计算。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using multi-layer meteorological sensors for data accuracy in measuring atmospheric conditions over high-altitude grasslands?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用多层气象传感器测量高海拔草原的气象条件对数据准确性的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using multi-layer meteorological sensors can significantly enhance data accuracy by capturing atmospheric conditions at various altitudes, which helps in understanding the vertical gradient of weather elements such as wind speed, temperature, and humidity. This comprehensive data collection can improve model estimations for evapotranspiration and other surface processes, especially in complex terrains like high-altitude grasslands.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用多层气象传感器可以显著提高数据的准确性，因为它能够在不同高度捕捉大气条件，这有助于理解风速、温度和湿度等天气元素的垂直梯度。这种全面的数据收集可以改善蒸散发和其他地表过程的模型估计，特别是在高海拔草原等复杂地形中。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the inclusion of soil temperature and moisture sensors at varying depths impact the understanding of soil-vegetation-atmosphere interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在不同深度加入土壤温度和湿度传感器，可能会对土壤-植被-大气相互作用的理解产生影响。
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Incorporating soil temperature and moisture sensors at varying depths allows for detailed insights into soil-vegetation-atmosphere interactions. This can help in accurately modeling soil heat flux and moisture dynamics, which are crucial for estimating evapotranspiration and improving land surface models. It provides a better understanding of how soil conditions affect vegetation growth and surface energy balance.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在不同深度安装土壤温度和湿度传感器可以深入了解土壤-植被-大气之间的相互作用。这有助于准确建模土壤热通量和湿度动态，这对于估算蒸散发和改善地表模型至关重要。它提供了对土壤条件如何影响植被生长和表面能量平衡的更好理解。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the effects of integrating high-resolution thermal imaging with ground-based measurements on the accuracy of evapotranspiration models?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将高分辨率热成像与地面测量相结合对蒸散发模型准确性的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating high-resolution thermal imaging with ground-based measurements can significantly enhance the accuracy of evapotranspiration models by providing precise soil and canopy component temperatures. This allows for more accurate partitioning of sensible and latent heat fluxes, improving the model's reliability in estimating evaporation and transpiration rates, especially in heterogeneous landscapes like the ones observed in the experimental area.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将高分辨率热成像与地面测量相结合，可以显著提高蒸散发模型的准确性，因为它提供了精确的土壤和树冠组件温度。这使得对显热和潜热通量的更准确划分成为可能，从而提高了模型在估算蒸发和蒸腾速率方面的可靠性，特别是在实验区域观察到的异质景观中。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to use high-resolution thermal imagery for estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，使用高分辨率热成像来估算蒸散发是重要的，因为它能够提供更精确的温度数据，从而更好地反映不同地表特征的水分状况和蒸散发过程。这种高分辨率的图像能够捕捉到微小的环境变化，帮助研究人员理解和量化不同植被类型、土壤条件和地形对蒸散发的影响，从而提高水资源管理和农业生产的效率。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: High-resolution thermal imagery allows for precise measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures, which are critical for accurately estimating evaporation, transpiration, and overall evapotranspiration in landscapes with mixed soil and vegetation, addressing the limitations of traditional single-source models.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热成像能够精确测量土壤和冠层成分的温度，这对于准确估算混合土壤和植被景观中的蒸发、蒸腾和整体蒸散发至关重要，克服了传统单一来源模型的局限性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are used to ensure the quality and accuracy of meteorological data collected in high-altitude environments?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保在高海拔环境中收集的气象数据质量和准确性所使用的程序有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control involve ensuring there are 144 data points collected every day, marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicate records, deleting data that are physically implausible or beyond the instrument's range, and flagging questionable data in red. Date and time are formatted consistently, with both being in the same column.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制涉及确保每天收集144个数据点，用-6999标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除物理上不合理或超出仪器范围的数据，并将可疑数据标记为红色。日期和时间格式一致，均在同一列中。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can ground-based measurements be effectively integrated with remote sensing data to improve the estimation of evapotranspiration components in mixed landscape environments?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何有效地将地面测量与遥感数据结合，以改善混合景观环境中蒸散发成分的估算？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Ground-based measurements such as soil and canopy component temperatures can be used to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET), with validation using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes and eddy covariance (EC) system measurements. The TSEB model utilizes these ground measurements, and the component temperatures are calculated using thermal camera images, converting them to radiation temperatures considering incoming long-wave radiation and emissivities.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 地面测量，如土壤和冠层组分温度，可以用来估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），并通过稳定氧和氢同位素以及涡度协方差（EC）系统测量进行验证。TSEB模型利用这些地面测量，组分温度通过热像仪图像计算，考虑到入射长波辐射和发射率，将其转换为辐射温度。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodological approaches are employed to separate soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperature measurements in agricultural regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在农业地区，采用哪些方法论方法来从复合辐射温度测量中分离土壤和植被成分的温度？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The approach involves using thermal infrared camera images classified into soil and canopy pixels with the maximum-likelihood method. Soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures are extracted from these thermal images. The thermal infrared temperatures are then converted to radiation temperatures, validated against surface radiometric temperatures calculated from incoming long-wave radiation observed by a four-component radiometer.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该方法涉及使用热红外相机图像，通过最大似然法将其分类为土壤和冠层像素。从这些热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。然后将热红外温度转换为辐射温度，并与通过四分量辐射计观察到的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions are necessary for the effective deployment of a multi-layered meteorological observation system in high-altitude mixed terrains?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在高海拔混合地形中有效部署多层次气象观测系统所需的条件是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The effective deployment of a multi-layered meteorological observation system in high-altitude mixed terrains requires precise positioning of sensors at various heights and orientations, such as wind speed/direction sensors at 3m to 40m facing north, and careful installation of other instruments like infrared thermometers and soil sensors at specified depths and orientations to ensure accurate data collection across different environmental conditions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在高海拔混合地形中，有效部署多层气象观测系统需要在不同高度和方向上精确定位传感器，例如在3米到40米高度朝北方向安装风速/风向传感器，以及在指定深度和方向上仔细安装其他仪器，如红外温度计和土壤传感器，以确保在不同环境条件下准确收集数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How can the integration of ground-based measurement systems with advanced imaging technologies enhance the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 将地面测量系统与先进成像技术的集成如何提高异质景观中蒸散发估算的准确性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of ground-based measurement systems with advanced imaging technologies, such as using thermal cameras and high-resolution thermal images, enables the accurate separation of soil and canopy component temperatures. This separation improves the estimation of evapotranspiration, evaporation, and transpiration rates by providing precise inputs for models like the TSEB, which can be validated against stable isotope techniques and eddy covariance measurements.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 地面测量系统与先进成像技术的结合，例如使用热像仪和高分辨率热图像，使得土壤和冠层组件温度的准确分离成为可能。这种分离通过为像TSEB这样的模型提供精确输入，改善了蒸散发、蒸发和蒸腾速率的估算，并可以与稳定同位素技术和涡度协方差测量进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological and methodological advancements enable the accurate measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures in complex agricultural settings?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术和方法学进展使得在复杂农业环境中准确测量土壤和冠层组件温度成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological advancements such as the use of high-precision thermal infrared cameras and the maximum-likelihood classification method for separating soil and canopy pixels from thermal images facilitate the accurate measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures. These methodologies allow for the effective modeling and validation of energy fluxes in complex agricultural settings, leading to reliable estimates of latent heat flux and evapotranspiration components.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术进步，如高精度热红外相机的使用和最大似然分类方法，用于从热图像中分离土壤和冠层像素，促进了土壤和冠层组件温度的准确测量。这些方法使得在复杂农业环境中有效建模和验证能量通量成为可能，从而可靠地估计潜热通量和蒸散发成分。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the data collection method for soil and canopy component temperatures require further refinement in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，土壤和冠层成分温度的数据收集方法可能需要进一步改进的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions, leading to difficulties in accurately measuring evaporation and transpiration on the ground. Errors primarily arise from image classification errors, particularly due to variations in vegetation abundance, affecting the estimation of canopy temperature.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限，导致在地面上准确测量蒸发和蒸腾的困难。错误主要源于图像分类错误，特别是由于植被丰度的变化，影响了冠层温度的估算。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected benefits of using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes in validating evapotranspiration measurements in combination with eddy covariance systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用稳定的氧和氢同位素来验证蒸散发测量的预期好处是什么，结合涡度协方差系统。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes in combination with eddy covariance systems is expected to provide better validation of estimated evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration. This combination helps in accurately partitioning the fluxes between soil and canopy, thus contributing to more reliable evapotranspiration estimates.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 使用稳定的氧和氢同位素结合涡度协方差系统，预计将更好地验证估算的蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散。这种组合有助于准确划分土壤和树冠之间的通量，从而为更可靠的蒸散估算做出贡献。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are your thoughts on the effectiveness of using ground-based measurement data in partitioning evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration in the context of complex landscape conditions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在复杂地形条件下，使用地面测量数据将蒸散发分为蒸发和植物蒸腾的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of ground-based measurement data, such as that from the eddy covariance system and thermal infrared cameras, provides a robust method for partitioning evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration. This approach can be effective, especially when coupled with models like the TSEB, which have been shown to provide reliable estimates even in strongly advective conditions. However, challenges such as image classification errors and atmospheric radiation influences need careful consideration.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用地面测量数据，如涡度协方差系统和热红外相机，提供了一种有效的方法来将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾。这种方法尤其有效，特别是当与像TSEB这样的模型结合使用时，这些模型在强对流条件下也能提供可靠的估计。然而，图像分类错误和大气辐射影响等挑战需要仔细考虑。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, how can datasets of meteorological parameters from different layers above the ground improve the understanding of surface energy balance in high-altitude regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我认为，不同高度层的气象参数数据集可以通过以下方式改善对高海拔地区表面能量平衡的理解：
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Datasets of meteorological parameters from multiple layers above the ground can significantly enhance the understanding of surface energy balance in high-altitude regions. By providing detailed profiles of wind speed, temperature, humidity, and radiation at various heights, these datasets allow for a more comprehensive analysis of atmospheric conditions, which is crucial for models that estimate energy exchanges between the surface and the atmosphere. This layered approach can lead to better insights into the interactions between soil, vegetation, and atmospheric components.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 来自多个高度的气象参数数据集可以显著增强对高海拔地区表面能量平衡的理解。通过提供不同高度的风速、温度、湿度和辐射的详细剖面，这些数据集允许对大气条件进行更全面的分析，这对于估算表面与大气之间能量交换的模型至关重要。这种分层方法可以带来对土壤、植被和大气成分之间相互作用的更深入见解。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the data collection techniques utilized for recording meteorological parameters in high-altitude regions and identify any potential challenges faced during this process.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请概述在高海拔地区记录气象参数所使用的数据收集技术，并识别在此过程中面临的潜在挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques involve installing sensors at various heights (3m to 40m) to measure wind speed, wind direction, air temperature, and relative humidity. Additional instruments like barometers, rain gauges, and radiometers are utilized for recording pressure, precipitation, and radiation. Challenges include ensuring data completeness, eliminating duplicate records, and filtering out data that exceed physical or instrumental limits.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集技术涉及在不同高度（3米到40米）安装传感器，以测量风速、风向、空气温度和相对湿度。还使用了气压计、雨量计和辐射计等附加仪器来记录气压、降水量和辐射。挑战包括确保数据的完整性、消除重复记录以及过滤超出物理或仪器限制的数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please evaluate the methodologies employed for processing and quality control of meteorological data collected from high-altitude mixed grassland and alpine meadow environments.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请评估在高海拔混合草原和高山草甸环境中收集的气象数据的处理和质量控制所采用的方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The methodologies include ensuring a consistent data recording frequency (144 records per day, every 10 minutes), marking missing data with a specific code (-6999), removing duplicate records, and excluding data beyond physical or instrumental ranges. Data with potential issues are highlighted for further review, ensuring uniform date and time formatting in a single column.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 这些方法包括确保一致的数据记录频率（每天144条记录，每10分钟一次），用特定代码（-6999）标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，以及排除超出物理或仪器范围的数据。潜在问题的数据会被标记以便进一步审查，确保日期和时间格式在一个列中统一。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets that can be utilized to validate the estimation of evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes using models such as the two-source energy balance model.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别可以用于验证异质景观中蒸散发估算的潜在数据集，使用的模型如双源能量平衡模型。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include those that provide ground-based measurements of soil and canopy component temperatures, such as those obtained from high-resolution thermal cameras and eddy covariance systems. These datasets can be validated with stable isotope techniques and compared with model outputs, offering insights into the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimations in diverse vegetation and climatic conditions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括提供土壤和树冠组分温度的地面测量数据，例如从高分辨率热像仪和涡度协方差系统获得的数据。这些数据集可以通过稳定同位素技术进行验证，并与模型输出进行比较，从而提供对不同植被和气候条件下蒸散发估算准确性的洞察。
